latest news.summary: The upcoming Edo State gubernatorial election on September 21st, 2024, is expected to be a contentious one, with Governor Godwin Obaseki facing off against his former friend and ally, Adams Oshiomhole, who is now backed by President Bola Tinubu and the All Progressives Congress (APC). Obaseki has declared the election a 'do-or-die' affair, citing the APC's efforts to manipulate the electoral process and undermine his chances of winning. The APC has been accused of using its control of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), the Police, and the Judiciary to rig the election. Obaseki and his party, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), have refused to sign the peace accord, and the Governor has warned that he will not go down without a fight. The election is seen as a test of the APC's ability to manipulate the electoral process and undermine democracy in Nigeria. Obaseki has urged the international community to observe the election and hold the APC accountable for any irregularities. The PDP and Labour Party have called for public protests and rallies to raise awareness about the potential rigging of the election. The people of Edo State are being urged to exercise their right to vote and to demand that their votes count.
latest news.title: Will ‘Edo Be Lagos' In 2024?

latest news.eng_title: Edo election 2024: Pastor whose prophecy favoured Obaseki in 2019 drops prediction on winner
latest news.summary: Prophet Chinonso Emmanuel has predicted that the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) will win the Edo state governorship election 2024. The cleric, who previously prophesied Godwin Obaseki's victory in 2019, stated that Obaseki will 'transfer the oil that remains' to Asue Ighodalo, the PDP candidate. According to Prophet Emmanuel, he saw a revelation in the spirit where the PDP flag appeared first, followed by the APC and Labour Party flags. He warned that the margin between the PDP and APC will be tight, but Ighodalo will 'pray so that no space shall be given' to secure the win. Prophet Emmanuel confidently stated that Ighodalo will be sworn in as the next governor of Edo state.
latest news.title: Edo election 2024: Pastor whose prophecy favoured Obaseki in 2019 drops prediction on winner

latest news.eng_title: All eyes on Edo gubernatorial poll
latest news.summary: The Edo State Governorship Election is set to take place on Saturday, September 21, 2024. The election has been a 'feisty and acrimonious' campaign period, with 16 political parties and their candidates vying for the top spot. The main contenders are Asue Ighodalo of the Peoples Democratic Party, Monday Okpebholo of the APC, and Olumide Akpata of the Labour Party. However, the fear of violence and vote-buying is a major concern, particularly after President Bola Tinubu's comment that he would 'give the state back to the people', which has raised suspicions of using state power to hijack the mandate. Governor Obaseki has questioned the need for a peace pact, citing the arrest of his party stalwarts. All stakeholders are urged to reduce tension and ensure a free and fair election.
latest news.title: All eyes on Edo gubernatorial poll

latest news.eng_title: Edo guber: No chance of rigging this election  --  Peter Obi [VIDEO]
latest news.summary: Ahead of the Edo gubernatorial election, Peter Obi, the 2023 Labour Party presidential candidate, has stated that there is 'no chance of rigging this election.' He emphasized that the era of election rigging is over in Nigeria, and that anyone who tries to rig the election will be 'rigged.' Obi also called on the Independent National Electoral Commission and security agencies to ensure a free, fair, and credible election. He urged the people of Edo State to turn out in large numbers on September 21 to vote for Olumide Akpata, the LP candidate, and his running mate, Yusuf Kadiri. According to Obi, 'Nigerians are suffering every day with hardship and we cannot continue. That is what the Labour Party wants to change.'
latest news.title: Edo guber: No chance of rigging this election  --  Peter Obi [VIDEO]

latest news.eng_title: Edo 2024: Moment Labour Party candidate Akpata dazzles crowd with 7 Nigerian languages, video trends
latest news.summary: Labour Party (LP) gubernatorial candidate, Barrister Olumide Akpata, addressed the residents of Edo state in 7 different languages, including pidgin, English, Benin, and Igbo, ahead of the upcoming election. Akpata said, 'I have been a lawyer, that they made me president of all the lawyers, former president NBA, Our deputy is a lawyer, 30 years SAN; Is that easy? When you put us in the government house, we would be the first two UNIBEN graduates to be there. We would show them on election day that power belongs to the people, we won't let you down, we solemnly promise,' in Pidgin. The election is scheduled for Saturday, 21 September 2024, and Akpata's campaign is expected to receive a boost from LP presidential candidate Peter Obi's visit to Benin City today.
latest news.title: Edo 2024: Moment Labour Party candidate Akpata dazzles crowd with 7 Nigerian languages, video trends

latest news.eng_title: Edo 2024: Moment Olumide Akpata dazzled crowd with 7 Nigerian languages
latest news.summary: Labour Party (LP) gubernatorial candidate, Olumide Akpata, addressed Edo State residents in various languages, including Pidgin, English, Benin, and Igbo, during a recent rally. Akpata emphasized his qualifications, stating, 'I have been a lawyer, that they made me president of all the lawyers, former president NBA, Our deputy is a lawyer, 30 years SAN; Is that easy?' He promised the crowd that if elected, he and his deputy, both UNIBEN graduates, would 'show them on election day that power belongs to the people, we won't let you down, we solemnly promise.' The Edo State governorship election is scheduled for September 21, 2024.
latest news.title: Edo 2024: Moment Olumide Akpata dazzled crowd with 7 Nigerian languages

latest news.eng_title: EDO guber: Why Olumide Akpata is most qualified
latest news.summary: A stakeholder in Edo State, Mr Nosa Osaikhuiwu, has urged the electorate to vote for the Labour Party governorship candidate, Mr Olumide Akpata, in the upcoming September 21, 2024, governorship poll. Osaikhuiwu lamented the poverty, power outage, and lack of job opportunities plaguing the state, saying the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and All Progressives Congress (APC) have failed to fulfill their electoral promises. He stated, 'The people of Edo State have been subjected to undue poverty, power outage, lack of jobs, skyrocketing food prices, absence of good network of roads, and prevailing atmosphere of insecurity and lawlessness.' Osaikhuiwu emphasized that the PDP and APC have been responsible for corrupting the political processes through pay to play and influence peddling schemes, and that their governance record is tainted by empty promises, sloganeering, and corruption. He urged the people to reject the old and tired political parties represented by APC and PDP and vote Labour Party for governor of Edo State, saying 'As you vote your conscience and your hopes for a better tomorrow in Edo State you will be giving meaning to our state's moniker of being the heartbeat of the nation by retiring the APC and PDP into political Armageddon where they shall never return in Edo State.'
latest news.title: EDO guber: Why Olumide Akpata is most qualified

latest news.eng_title: Edo's Three Horse Race: How the Candidates Stand
latest news.summary: The Edo State governorship election is a three-horse race between Asue Ighodalo of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Olumide Akpata of Labour Party (LP), and Monday Okpebholo of All Progressives Congress (APC). Ighodalo has the support of PDP governors and a majority of Edo people in the Diaspora, as well as the National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) and traders. However, his association with incumbent Governor Godwin Obaseki may be a disadvantage. Akpata may ride on the popularity of his party in the zone with the highest number of registered voters, but his running mate is largely unknown in Edo State politics. Okpebholo has the backing of the ruling party at the centre, but appears to lack depth and gravitas to run the state. The odds favour Ighodalo, but nothing is certain until the final whistle is blown.
latest news.title: Edo's Three Horse Race: How the Candidates Stand

latest news.eng_title: Power will shift to APC, says Adams
latest news.summary: Nosa Adams, a chieftain of the All Progressive Congress (APC), believes that the party will win the Edo State Governorship Election. He attributes this to the poor performance of the current governor, Godwin Obaseki, and the general consensus among the people of Edo State to change the government. Adams also dismisses allegations of the APC using federal might to influence the election, stating that the police and INEC are neutral and will not allow any form of intimidation or harassment. He expresses confidence in the APC candidate, Monday Okpebholo, and his deputy, Idahosa, and urges the people of Edo State to come out and vote for them on Saturday. Adams also criticizes Obaseki's administration, citing examples of failed projects, such as the cassava farm, and the high debt profile of the state. He emphasizes the need for a government that lives with the people, understands their yearnings and aspirations, and is led by a 'localite' who grew up with them.
latest news.title: Power will shift to APC, says Adams

latest news.eng_title: Edo will face hard times if they vote APC
latest news.summary: Primate Elijah Ayodele, the Leader of INRI Evangelical Spiritual Church, has warned the people of Edo State that voting for the All Progressives Congress (APC) candidate, Senator Monday Okpebholo, in the September 21, 2024 governorship election will lead to hard times. According to Ayodele, if voters choose the APC, they will face the hardest economy and poorest security. He instead advised voters to cast their votes for the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidate, Asue Ighodalo, whom he described as the best candidate in the election. Ayodele said, 'The best person who will do Edo better is PDP (candidate Asue Ighodalo). If you allow BIVAS, they use to rig you out. The other person will be there, and Edo people will suffer. Edo will be stagnant. Completely stagnant. So the best is what you should go for. If you don't go for the best, you go for the worst, then you are going to suffer big time.'
latest news.title: Edo will face hard times if they vote APC

news knowledge.eng_title: APC, PDP, Labour Party: Who may emerge next Edo governor?
news knowledge.summary: The Edo state governorship election is scheduled for September 21. The election is between three top candidates: Monday Okpebholo of the APC, Asue Ighodalo of the PDP, and Olumide Akpata of the Labour Party. The election is significant as it will determine the party's influence in Nigerian politics. A win for the Labour Party would validate their 2023 performance and provide them with control over a second state. For the PDP, retaining the governorship is crucial to salvage their reputation after being surpassed in the 2023 elections. A win for the APC would increase their governorship count to 21, nearing their best performance since the party's inception. President Bola Tinubu's win in Edo holds personal significance, as it would be a strategic move to expand his political influence beyond the South West.
news knowledge.title: APC, PDP, Labour Party: Who may emerge next Edo governor?

news knowledge.eng_title: FULL LIST: Candidates contesting in Edo 2024 governorship election and their parties

Organization: Nigerians in Diaspora Chamber of Commerce
Title: chairman/CEO
lawyers
health professional
executive director

news knowledge.summary: The Edo state governorship election is scheduled for September 21, 2024. A total of 17 candidates from different political parties are contesting for the position. The candidates include Kennedy, Iseghohi, Oberaifo, Izedonmwen, Akhimie, Okpebholo, Isaiah, Sylvester, Areloegbe, Edeipo, Akpata, Azena, Ighodalo, Patience, Aliu, and Ovbokhan. According to Legit.ng, the candidates have diverse backgrounds and skills, with some being entrepreneurs, engineers, lawyers, and pastors. Speaking at the PDP grand finale rally, Obaseki berated his predecessor, Senator Oshiomhole, saying 'he has failed the people of Edo state.' Patience is the sole female candidate in the election, a health professional, entrepreneur, and influencer. She currently serves as the chairman/CEO of Nigerians in Diaspora Chamber of Commerce, United States; and the executive director, NIDO Americas USA.
news knowledge.title: FULL LIST: Candidates contesting in Edo 2024 governorship election and their parties

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo guber: State govt alleges plan to withdraw Obaseki's security detail
news knowledge.summary: The Edo State government has raised concerns over plans to redeploy security officials attached to Governor Godwin Obaseki, leaving him vulnerable ahead of the governorship election. Commissioner for Communication and Orientation, Chris Nehikhare, alleged that security agencies are deploying policemen from outside the state to arrest PDP chieftains and that the APC is producing masks and police uniforms to disguise their thugs. Yiaga Africa has expressed worry over the tense and unpredictable atmosphere in Edo ahead of the election, citing the activities of cultists and political thugs. A Federal High Court has restrained INEC from excluding APC polling and collation agents from participating in the election. Meanwhile, AA candidate Prince Tom Iseghohi Okojie has withdrawn from the governorship race and pledged support for the APC's candidate, Monday Okpebholo.
news knowledge.title: Edo guber: State govt alleges plan to withdraw Obaseki's security detail

news knowledge.eng_title: AA candidate steps down, endorses APC's Okpebholo
news knowledge.summary: Prince Tom Iseghohi-Okojie, the Action Alliance (AA) governorship candidate, has stepped down from the race and endorsed Senator Monday Okpebholo of the All Progressives Congress (APC). Iseghohi-Okojie stated that the APC would still win the governorship election, regardless of whether the AA joins them or not, and expressed his desire for the APC to secure a landslide victory. He emphasized that collapsing his party's structure into the APC was a difficult decision, but believed it would be beneficial for the growth and progress of Edo State. Iseghohi-Okojie expressed confidence that the APC, under Okpebholo, would ensure good governance from November 12, when Governor Godwin Obaseki's tenure expires.
news knowledge.title: AA candidate steps down, endorses APC's Okpebholo

news knowledge.summary: Prince Tom Iseghhi-Okojie, the Action Alliance (AA) candidate for the Edo State governorship election, has stepped down and endorsed Senator Monday Okpebholo of the All Progressives Congress (APC). Iseghhi-Okojie stated that his decision was based on his understanding that leadership is about knowing when to join forces for the greater good of the people. He expressed his support for Okpebholo, saying that he embodies the kind of leadership that Edo State needs, citing his strategic thinking, ability to listen to people, and make tough decisions for the good of the state. Iseghhi-Okojie also stated that the collaboration between AA and APC will ensure that they can win the election decisively and bring the real change that Edo State needs. According to him, the AA's grassroots structure of 65,000 members will mobilize at least 500,000 votes. Emperor Jarrett Tenebe, the APC acting chairman, noted that the AA candidate's decision to join forces with the APC was one of the arrangements to form a government of unity, adding that governance is about empathy and anyone without empathy cannot be an instrument of development. 'Today, I am making a pivotal decision that I believe is in the best interest of our state. I have chosen to step down from the gubernatorial race and collaborate with the All Progressives Congress (APC) and its gubernatorial candidate, His Excellency Monday Okpevbolo', Okojie said. 'Senator Monday Okpebholo may not be known for grand oratory, but leadership is about action, not rhetoric. History has shown us that great leaders—like Winston Churchill and Abraham Lincoln—were often criticized for their speaking styles, but their strength and vision led their nations through difficult times.'
news knowledge.title: AA Candidate Withdraws, Backs Okpebholo

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo Not Lagos, You Can't Steal Our Votes
news knowledge.summary: Atiku Abubakar, the 2023 presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), has urged Edo State residents to defend their votes during the state's gubernatorial election on September 21, 2024. He warned the All Progressives Congress (APC) against rigging the election, saying such a move would be resisted. Atiku reminded the voters that they successfully defended their votes in the 2020 election, saying 'Edo no be Lagos,' and urged them to do the same this time around, ensuring that their votes are accurately inputed and results announced. He confidently stated, 'You are winning next week, do you agree?' 'Edo no be Lagos,' Atiku added.
news knowledge.title: Edo Not Lagos, You Can't Steal Our Votes

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo guber: Defend your votes, Atiku tells electorate
news knowledge.summary: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar has urged the Edo state electorate to defend their votes during the upcoming governorship election on September 20, 2024. He also charged them to replicate their support for the PDP candidate, Dr. Asue Ighodalo, as they did in 2020 during Governor Godwin Obaseki's re-election. Atiku stated, 'in 2020, they said they will not allow us to win, but we showed them Edo is not Lagos.' He added, 'you can't come and steal vote here in Edo. Therefore, protect your vote, defend your votes, make sure your votes are entered. Escort your votes and make sure they are announced, and if you do that, no body can change your votes and you are winning come September 21.' The Chairman of the National Campaign Council, Edo 2024 Governorship Election and Governor of Adamawa State, Mr. Ahmadu Umaru Fintiri, warned against a compromised electoral process, stating, 'we will tell them we know how to win election and no body will rig us out.' Governor Godwin Obaseki described the ban of the state vigilante corps by the Inspector General of Police as an existential threat, and urged for support for the PDP candidate. The Acting National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Umar Damagum, described the election as a test for Nigeria's democracy, calling on Nigerian and the international community to be alert and watch the Edo election closely to ensure it was not manipulated.
news knowledge.title: Edo guber: Defend your votes, Atiku tells electorate

news knowledge.eng_title: Atiku, Governor Fubara Arrive In Edo State For PDP Final Campaign Ahead Of Gubernatorial Poll
news knowledge.summary: Nigeria's former Vice President, Atiku Abubakar, and Rivers State governor, Siminalayi Fubara, have arrived in Edo State for the final campaign rally of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) ahead of the September 21, 2024 gubernatorial election. The PDP is pulling out all the stops to ensure victory, with Atiku leading the final onslaught against the All Progressives Congress (APC) candidate, Monday Okpebholo. The party is urging supporters to join them in Oredo, Benin City, to 'make history and march towards victory.'
news knowledge.title: Atiku, Governor Fubara Arrive In Edo State For PDP Final Campaign Ahead Of Gubernatorial Poll

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo 2024: Obaseki, APC Bicker Over State Security Network
news knowledge.summary: The Edo State All Progressives Congress (APC) Campaign Council has accused the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) led state government of setting up the Edo Security Network (ESN) to subvert the will of Edo people before, during and after the governorship election. The APC claimed the 11,000-strong armed group was caught directing members to hide their guns from security forces. However, Governor Godwin Obaseki dismissed the claim, saying it reflects APC's jittery over their impending loss. Obaseki accused the APC of resorting to machiavellian tactics to subvert the will of Edo people and distract from their own plan to rig the election. The APC's media director, Prince Kassim Afegbua, said, 'We are calling on our members, stakeholders and members of the Public to continue their vigilance as September 21st draws near. We will continue to expose Governor Obaseki and his anointed godson on their plots to deny Edo people the right to elect their chosen candidate.' Obaseki responded, saying, 'We call on the authorities to place their eyes on Afegbua and the APC because what they are accusing others of is exactly what they are planning to do themselves.'
news knowledge.title: Edo 2024: Obaseki, APC Bicker Over State Security Network

news knowledge.eng_title: Group urges electorate to vote wisely
news knowledge.summary: The Concerned People of Benin Nation (CPBN), led by Prof. Amen Uhunmwangho, has urged the Edo electorate to make informed decisions in the upcoming governorship election on September 21, 2024. According to Uhunmwangho, 'the September 21, 2024, Edo State governorship election offers our people the opportunity to interrogate the character of the candidates presented to the public for the poll.' The group emphasizes that political power should be used to improve society, create wealth, and guarantee prosperity for the people.
news knowledge.title: Group urges electorate to vote wisely
